results.title: Animals of Australia
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Australia and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description: An overview of Australian animals, grouped according to their natural habitat - the dry inland, open forests, rain forests and coastal areas. Both well known and lesser known animals are seen. Elementary descriptive treatment. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Educational Media Australia and Ken J. Widdowson
results.description: An overview of Australian animals, grouped according to their natural habitat - the dry inland, open forests, rain forests and coastal areas. Both well known and lesser known animals are seen. Elementary descriptive treatment. Suitable for primary school level.
description_for_label: An overview of Australian animals, grouped according to their natural habitat - the dry inland, open forests, rain forests and coastal areas. Both well known and lesser known animals are seen. Elementary descriptive treatment. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Animals of Asia
results.creator_credit: Chatsworth Film Productions and Centron Films
results.brief_description: An overview of animals and birds of Asia. Includes flying foxes, snakes, deer, tigers, mud skippers and orangutans. Written by Michael Boorer of the Zoological Society of London. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: An overview of animals and birds of Asia. Includes flying foxes, snakes, deer, tigers, mud skippers and orangutans. Written by Michael Boorer of the Zoological Society of London. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animals of Africa
results.brief_description: Show how leopards, lions, zebras, rhinoceroses and other animals of East Africa live in their natural environment.

results.title: Animals move in many ways [revised]
results.brief_description: Presents a basic introduction to the ways different animals move. Looks at the movement of animals on land, at sea and through the air.

results.title: Animals in winter
results.creator_credit: Heinz Sielmann Productions and Heinz Sielmann
results.brief_description: The behaviour in winter of squirrels, hamsters, insects, frogs, butterflies and other creatures, showing how they cope with the rigours of cold and the shortage of food in order to survive until the spring. Intended for primary and secondary schools
results.description: The behaviour in winter of squirrels, hamsters, insects, frogs, butterflies and other creatures, showing how they cope with the rigours of cold and the shortage of food in order to survive until the spring. Intended for primary and secondary schools

results.title: Animals in modern life
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Deals with the wide variety of uses to which animals are put in our modern civilisation - to furnish food, clothing materials, and power. Shows how animals have been domesticated and now, while power uses of animals are decreasing, more and more are being used for food and for clothing.

results.title: Animals hear in many ways. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean Films, BFA Educational Media and George J. Holland
results.brief_description: Indicates that animals hear when sound vibrations produce similar vibrations in their own bodies. Shows that different parts of animals’ bodies may be specifically adapted to receive these vibrations. Shows the ways in which dogs, elephants, bats, fish, snakes and some insects hear. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Animals can bite
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, John Hart Films and John Hart
results.brief_description: Instructs children on how to avoid being bitten by animals encountered on the street and what to do when someone is bitten by any kind of animal. Suitable for primary school level.
